                    ### Question
                    Which of the following statements about fluconazole is most accurate?

                    ### Options
                    opa. It is highly effective in the treatment of aspergillosis
opb. It does not penetrate the blood-brain barrier
opc. Its oral bioavailability is less than that of ketoconazole
opd. It inhibits demethylation of lanosterol

### Enhanced Information (For Contextual Support):
The most accurate statement about Fluconazole is that it inhibits the demethylation of lanosterol. This reflects its mechanism of action against fungal infections by targeting cytochrome P450 enzymes involved in fungal cell membrane synthesis. Contrary to some options, Fluconazole is known for good CNS penetration and has high oral bioavailability, comparable to or better than ketoconazole. It is not highly effective against aspergillosis, as it is primarily designed to treat yeast infections.
